model_input:
Your task is to choose the better response based on the below criterion.
You will be given a list of past memories, a current conversation between two individuals, and two options of next responses.

CRITERION:
Consistency - The response should not contain information that contradicts the past memory.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the response that has better Consistency given the past memories and current conversation.

PAST MEMORIES:


CURRENT CONVERSATION:
Parent: You know, I always valued being a good listener. It's an important skill to have in life.
Child: Yeah, I think listening is really important too. I always feel heard when I talk to you.
Parent: That's great to hear. I think listening is especially important when people are going through a tough time. It can make a big difference to feel like someone is really hearing you.
Child: Did you feel like that when you were in detention? Like nobody was really listening to you?
Parent: Yeah, it was tough. I felt so alone and scared, and I didn't know if anyone would understand what I was going through. But eventually, I found someone who was willing to listen and it made all the difference.
Child: I'm glad you found someone to talk to. You know, I remember when we watched the sunrise together a few weeks ago. That was really special.
Parent: It was. I love being able to appreciate the beauty of nature. And you know, having my own place to live in the suburbs makes it even easier to do things like that.
Child: Yeah, your house is really nice. You've always been good at taking care of yourself.
Parent: Well, I've always valued my independence. Even as a kid, I wanted to do things on my own. That's why I decided to live on my own a few years ago.
Child: I can see why you would want to do that. You're just really good at being self-sufficient.
Parent: Thanks for saying that. But I still think one of the most important things I can do for others is listen. Whether it's to give advice, or just to let someone feel heard. 

RESPONSE 1
Child: I appreciate how you're always there to listen to me. It means a lot to feel understood by you.
RESPONSE 2
Child: You're right, listening is such a valuable skill. I'm grateful that you've always been there to listen to me and others. Your ability to empathize and truly hear people has made a big difference in so many lives, including mine.

YOUR OUTPUT:
Explanation:

memory_text:
The parent values independence and self-sufficiency, which is why they decided to live on their own a few years ago. This decision was influenced by their desire to provide a safe and stable environment for the child. 
The parent's past experience of being in juvenile detention and going through a tough time when they got arrested led them to appreciate small moments and find hope even in difficult situations. This ultimately shaped their decision to live in a little house in the suburbs that they love.

raw_prediction: I appreciate how you're always there to listen to me. It means a lot to feel understood by you.
prediction:
Explanation: Both responses are consistent with the current conversation. Response 1 acknowledges the parent's ability to listen, which is a recurring theme in the conversation, and appreciates feeling understood by the parent, which aligns with the previous acknowledgment of feeling heard. Response 2 expands on this by emphasizing the value of the parent's listening skills and their impact on the child, as well as possibly others. This aligns with the parent's expressed belief in the importance of listening to give advice or let someone feel heard. Neither response contradicts any past memories or current conversation facts.

Choice: tie
